column4: by the way anyone knows how to migrate an existing ubuntu into an stripped down ubuntu without pain?
with migrate i mean to replace the OS but keeping the preferences of importyant things there, in fact, databases, and svn repositories, and vsftp

what i did between hardy to intrepid was identify all setting files and applied them to a virtualbox install and tested, created scripts and what not then install intrepid on another partition -- you can see where i'm going at this point
mmmm the problem is... i ahve already a vm and... and that vm use real partitions, no way to clone the vm, not with ease
